topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bc2d7363687207b14e0600#post_54bc2d7363687207b14e0600
On no, Oh no your right.

The DmC game, Holy shit.

 "@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bc2c5e63687242617d0900#post_54bc2c5e63687242617d0900
I see I see.

Well the way I see it the show is about giant beings that eat people so of course it isn't going to be pretty.

Yeah I guess you could make it lighter but I see it more of a realistic stand point. What if this actually happen?

Shit wouldn't be fun and games! You'd go through stress and many other things, and see some messed up shit as well.

But that's just me. I'm not really much when it comes to explaining things. 

Ok now I will say Eren, eeeeh, isn't much of a character I like, he's ok of course, but Fact I guess one of the things a enjoyed were the other characters. 

He's a little bland in ways, like he's missing something?
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
So Eren and Mikasa are busy chatting up with the drunk guards...

Yeah, can't wait to see them fail spectacularly once a Titan shows up.
topics.author: 536f7a11636872666e2d0000

topics.body: I think my problem with AoT is that does the one thing I hate in writing. It kills off non-important characters to create a false sense of danger. And that is cheating of the highest caliber.  I've always believed that a writer's most valuable resource is his or her characters. They are the ones who live the story you create. In AoT, the writer just kills off any character who's likable until all we're left with is a bunch of idiots and assholes. If your characters aren't likable and the world isn't interesting,  then what is incentive to read or watch something?
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
